basics.name: Jose Miguel Herrera
basics.label: Software Engineer, Blockchain Evangelist & Music Producer
basics.summary: Jose Herrera was born in Colombia, but moved to Canada at the age of 6. Today based out of Toronto. Passionate about technology and music. Current obsession: how can Blockchain technology change industry, society, and government?

work.summary: Helping build the future of finance.
highlights: Lead developer of the Novera platform - reporting directly to the CTO.
Using solidity, web3js, react, ganache, mythril, truffle, and meadowsuite.
Ownership of devops processes and cloud infrustructure.
Helping implement organizational cybersecurity.
Aiding in the hiring process to grow the engineering team.

work.summary: Helped build the Polymath STO platform.
highlights: Helped bring the Polymath Dapp to main net.
Used solidity, web3js, react, redux, and ganache.

work.summary: A social experiment that lies at the intersection of conceptual art, cutting edge tech, and a discussion of issues relevant to our times. On the billboard, you can pay some Ether to display anything you want, as long as you pay the current market price, which is calculated from the price paid for the last ad and the time since it was put up. We want to explore themes of cryptoeconomics, free speech, and human nature.
highlights: Built on Ethereum/Solidity
Raised ~1000$ at peak times
Vitalik Buterin provided feedback on how to improve, which was implemented in version 2.

work.summary: BlockVote is an ongoing project in which blockchain technology is leveraged to allow distributed computing in order to solve the concerns of security, anonymity and verification that affect traditional voting systems.
highlights: Built with Hyperledger Fabric and nodeJS.
Uses state of the art encryption to ensure only the voter knows that a cast ballot belongs to them.
Voters vote on a mobile (Android) application after they get registered by a registrar, who also uses an Android app.
Elections can be configured in terms of start/end dates, number of voting sub-districts, and if live results are enabled.

work.summary: Critical Mass is an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer. Developer interns assist in implementing digital solutions for world-class brands.
highlights: Architected and implemented a scalable software project to automate marketing science activities with the goal of reducing costs across the board. (NodeJS/GraphQL/MongoDB/JS-HTML-CSS)
Worked on the Travel Alberta account (web development)
Created a React Native application for internal use
Participated in Citi FinTech Citiblue reboot. Did UI/UX/technical feasibility/fintech research/requirement analysis

work.summary: IBM Business Process Manager is a full-featured, consumable business process management (BPM) platform. It includes tooling and run time for process design and execution, along with capabilities for monitoring and optimizing work that is executed within the platform.
highlights: Worked in a team to develop and maintain IBMâ€™s Business Process Management software, using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Assisted in the architectural endeavour of porting BPM to the cloud.
Ensured that the BPM software was accessible to customers with disabilities.
Tested the BPM software using both blackbox and whitebox methodologies, such as Selenium WebDriver.
Created testing documentation while keeping Agile methodologies.

volunteer.summary: WebApp used in CIBC's 2015 Run For The Cure in Toronto. Used to significantly speed up the check in process by allowing volunteers with iPads to check in participants who had previously registered online.
highlights: Built with NodeJS and Cloudant
Sponsored by IBM

education.institution: University of Calgary - Schulich School of Engineering

publications.name: University of Calgary students close in on fraud-proof electronic voting system
publications.summary: Herrera along with his four team members are using IBM's Blockchain technology to create what they hope will be fraud-proof electronic voting
